Protocols/LucidErrorMessageProvider.html.name: networkingError(_:)
Protocols/LucidErrorMessageProvider.html.abstract: Moya network request was not successful. No network connection, bad network connection, permission error, SSL error, etc.

Protocols/LucidErrorMessageProvider.html.name: moyaError(_:)
Protocols/LucidErrorMessageProvider.html.abstract: Moya error encountered. This is a Moya specific error. It could be because Moya had an error parsing the response body to JSON/Image/String. It could be an invalid status code. This is probably an error that you should fix in your app’s code. It may not be a user issue.

Protocols/LucidErrorMessageProvider.html.name: LucidErrorMessageProvider
Protocols/LucidErrorMessageProvider.html.abstract: Protocol used to return a human readable error message you can use to show to user in your app.

Extensions/PrimitiveSequence.html#/s:7Rx.name: subscribeProcessErrors(errorHandler:onSuccess:onError:)
Extensions/PrimitiveSequence.html#/s:7Rx.abstract: Use in replace of existing .subscribe() function to process any of the thrown errors in the Observable chain and return a human readable error for thrown error.

Extensions/ObservableType.html#/s:7RxSwi.name: filter(statusCodes:)
Extensions/ObservableType.html#/s:7RxSwi.abstract: Filters out responses that don’t fall within the given range, generating a MoyaError status code error when others are encountered.

Extensions/ObservableType.html#/s:7RxSwi.name: filterSuccessfulStatusCodesAppend(code:statusCodes:)
Extensions/ObservableType.html#/s:7RxSwi.abstract: Filters out responses that do not have a status code >=200, <300 and don’t fall within the given range, a MoyaError status code error errors when others are encountered.

Extensions/ObservableType.html#/s:7RxSwi.name: filterSuccessfulStatusAndRedirectCodesAppend(code:statusCodes:)
Extensions/ObservableType.html#/s:7RxSwi.abstract: Filters out responses that do not have a status code >=200, <400 and don’t fall within the given range, a MoyaError status code error errors when others are encountered.

Extensions/Response.html#/s:4Moya8Respon.name: filter(statusCodes:)
Extensions/Response.html#/s:4Moya8Respon.abstract: Filters out responses that don’t fall within the given range, generating a MoyaError status code error when others are encountered.

Extensions/Response.html#/s:4Moya8Respon.name: filterSuccessfulStatusCodesAppend(code:statusCodes:)
Extensions/Response.html#/s:4Moya8Respon.abstract: Filters out responses that do not have a status code >=200, <300 and don’t fall within the given range, generating a MoyaError status code error when others are encountered.

Extensions/Response.html#/s:4Moya8Respon.name: filterSuccessfulStatusAndRedirectCodesAppend(code:statusCodes:)
Extensions/Response.html#/s:4Moya8Respon.abstract: Filters out responses that do not have a status code >=200, <400 and don’t fall within the given range, generating a MoyaError status code error when others are encountered.

Extensions/Swift/Error.html#/s:s5ErrorP5.name: getLucidError(errorHandler:)
Extensions/Swift/Error.html#/s:s5ErrorP5.abstract: Take the error that Moya returned to you after performing the networking request to get a better, human readable error message LucidMoyaResponseError.

Extensions/Response.html.name: Response
Extensions/Response.html.abstract: These functions exist for convenience. Moya provides .filter() functions for status codes, but I wanted to provide functions to filter arrays of status codes. What if I want to filter codes 401, 403 - 422, 500 - 600? That’s a rediculous example, but if someone wants to do that, then they can with these functions.

Extensions/ObservableType.html.name: ObservableType
Extensions/ObservableType.html.abstract: These functions exist for convenience. Moya provides .filter() functions for status codes, but I wanted to provide functions to filter arrays of status codes. What if I want to filter codes 401, 403 - 422, 500 - 600? That’s a rediculous example, but if someone wants to do that, then they can with these functions.

Enums/LucidMoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:5.name: badNetworkRequest
Enums/LucidMoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:5.abstract: Network request failed from some error that could be from a bad network connection.

Enums/LucidMoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:5.name: failedNetworkRequest
Enums/LucidMoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:5.abstract: All other URLError types. In most cases, these errors are a result of a developer error. A user should not encounter these errors such as having SSL cert issues, permission issues, file issues, etc.

Enums/LucidMoyaError.html#/s:5Lucid0A9Mo.name: networkingError
Enums/LucidMoyaError.html#/s:5Lucid0A9Mo.abstract: The user encountered a networking issue with their API request.

Enums/LucidMoyaError.html#/s:5Lucid0A9Mo.name: statusCodeError
Enums/LucidMoyaError.html#/s:5Lucid0A9Mo.abstract: The request was successful, but the status code is >= 300.

Enums/LucidMoyaError.html#/s:5Lucid0A9Mo.name: moyaError
Enums/LucidMoyaError.html#/s:5Lucid0A9Mo.abstract: Moya specific error. Moya had an error mapping response body to JSON, Image, String, etc.

Enums/LucidMoyaError.html.name: LucidMoyaError
Enums/LucidMoyaError.html.abstract: The error type that we return to the Moya Target’s error handler in your app code.

Enums/LucidMoyaNetworkingError.html.name: LucidMoyaNetworkingError
Enums/LucidMoyaNetworkingError.html.abstract: Moya encountered a networking error with the request. These errors are all URLError types.

Classes/LucidConfiguration.html.name: LucidConfiguration
Classes/LucidConfiguration.html.abstract: Configure Lucid. Set defaults for the plugin.
